com.percussion.loader
Interface IPSFieldTransformer

All Superinterfaces:
IPSPlugin
public interface IPSFieldTransformer
extends IPSPlugin

See base interface for a more generic description. Plugins implementing this interface fit into the migration/loader model after the resource has been converted to a 'standard item'. A transformer can be used to modify the content of a field, add a new field or clear a field. A transformer must accept 1 or more parameters that contain the data to be transformed or information needed to perform the transform. These parameters are passed through an array.

The output of the transformer is the data for the target field. If the returned object is not a String, toString will be called on it to convert it.

The target field name and the source for each parameter is specified in the configuration for the transformer. This allows transformers to be easily reused.

Method Summary
 void transform(Object[] params, com.percussion.loader.IPSTransformContext info)
          Transforms the data in the supplied params into the desired format.
 
Methods inherited from interface com.percussion.loader.IPSPlugin
configure
 

Method Detail

transform

void transform(Object[] params,
               com.percussion.loader.IPSTransformContext info)
               throws com.percussion.loader.PSParameterValidationException,
                      com.percussion.loader.PSTransformationException
Transforms the data in the supplied params into the desired format. Field transformers allow the following parameter types:
TypeDescription
java.lang.ObjectAny java object that can be constructed from a String and implements the toString() method.

Parameters:
params - an array of transformation parameters, never null, may be empty. The configuration determines how many params there are and where their values are obtained from. The class types of the parameters may vary, as indicated in the table above.
info - data pertinent to the field being transformed, such as the PSItemField object. Never null.
Throws:
PSParameterValidationException - if the supplied parameters don't match what the transformer expects. This means the configuration entry does not match the transformer interface.
PSTransformationException - for anything that goes wrong during the transformation.
